description: It's never a bad time for an easy scone recipe. Bake these cosy gluten-free scones with parmesan cheese and herbs for your next afternoon tea.
keywords: Scone,Pescatarian,Seafood free,Tree nut free,Egg free,Video,Low sugar,Baking,Halal,Wheat free,Vegetarian,Mar 2021,Peanut free
name: Gluten-Free Herb Scones Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 1.75 cup Woolworths free from gluten self-raising flour (plus extra for dusting)
60g unsalted butter, chilled, chopped (plus extra softened butter to serve)
0.33 cup fresh mixed herbs, finely chopped

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 220°C/200°C fan-forced. Line a baking tray with baking paper.
Sift flours, baking powder and salt into a large bowl. Using fingertips, rub butter into flour mixture until mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Stir in herbs.

Make a well in centre of mixture. Using a flat-bladed knife, stir in buttermilk until a sticky dough forms. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead gently until just smooth. Pat until 3cm thick. Using a floured 5.5cm round cutter, cut out rounds. Press leftover dough together. Repeat to make a total 9 rounds.

Place rounds, just touching, on tray. Brush with extra buttermilk. Sprinkle with parmesan and season. Bake for 12 minutes or until light golden and hollow when tapped on top. Serve scones with extra butter and herbs.
